question: Which country houses the "Gullfoss Waterfalls"?
explanation: Iceland houses the "Gullfoss Waterfalls". Gullfoss is a waterfall located in the canyon of the Hvita river in southwest Iceland. Gullfoss is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Iceland. Together with Thingvellir and the geysers of Haukadalur, Gullfoss forms part of the Golden Circle, a popular day excursion for tourists in Iceland.
